channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hoarding completely blocks Great Chapel St, 17th September
item.description:
This hoarding from a construction site at 91-92 Dean st completely blocks the highway on Great Chapel st at the corner of Sheraton Street. It does not have a valid licence, and prevents cyclists from using Great Chapel St. I do not think it should be granted a licence to occupy the highway in this way - there is no need for it to do so. The site manager told me that he had applied for another licence but it had not been granted, but he had decided to leave the hoarding on the highway anyway. I think enforcement action should be taken, as the site manager is clearly aware that it is not licensed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Great Chapel Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sheraton Street Blocked by construction, 17th September
item.description:
The Construction Site at 142-150 Wardour Street is using all of Sheraton Street as storage for building materials and rubbish and as a loading bay. It prevents access for bicycles to Great Chapel St, and prevents pedestrian passage also

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheraton Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The problem is not about the traffic light in your list there was no apption for junction box so, 17th September
item.description:
Dear Southwark Council, I would like to bring to your attention some urgent traffic issues in the Elephant and Castle area. A few additional yellow box junctions are needed to improve traffic flow. One is required at the junction of Newington Causeway and Elephant and Castle. Another is needed between London Road and Elephant and Castle. At present, vehicles turning from London Road towards New Kent Road often block traffic coming from Newington Causeway, making it extremely difficult for cars to pass through towards the Kennington Park side. I kindly request that the Council urgently review this matter, as it would greatly help to ease congestion and improve safety in the area. Thank you for your attention. Yours faithfully
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: England flags with big red lines in red spray paint covering the pedestrian crossing bollards that should be lit up properly., 17th September
item.description:
Firstly these caused me to be distracted when driving at night which increased the danger of me driving around the junction. Secondly it’s offended me as it feeds the racist anti immigration ‘take back our country’ right wing and fascist agenda taking place in our country as we speak.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Forest bike blocking path, 17th September
item.description:
Yet another Forest bike positioned to deliberately block the path. On the east footpath of Tennyson Road. It has been left in the middle of the path as shown on the photograph. It is clear no attempt has been made to put it to the side to prevent blocking buggies, wheelchairs, etc.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tennyson Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old lamp post disconnected. New one installed but not working., 17th September
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned bike which I reported 25 Sept 2024, 10 Sept 2025 and again today., 17th September
item.description:
This bicycle was abandoned by a departed tenant 2yrs ago. It has fallen over again and is a trip hazard once more. On the 10 Sept I forgot to meantion it also has flat tyres. 164 Cambridge St, Pimlico, London SW1V 4QE. Please dispose of it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Street, Pimlico, London
